results.title: Hyaluronic acid receptor CD44 deficiency is associated with decreased Cryptococcus neoformans brain infection.
results.text_hl: Importantly, our studies demonstrated an in vivo blocking effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@. These results suggest that the @GENE_CD44 @GENE_12505 @@@CD44@@@ and @GENE_HMMR @GENE_15366 @@@RHAMM@@@ receptors function on membrane @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ rafts during invasion and that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ may have a potential therapeutic role in @<m>DISEASE_Cryptococcosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003453 @@@C. neoformans infections of the brain@@@.

citations.NLM: Jong A, Wu CH, Gonzales-Gomez I, Kwon-Chung KJ, Chang YC, Tseng HK, Cho WL, Huang SH. Hyaluronic acid receptor CD44 deficiency is associated with decreased Cryptococcus neoformans brain infection. J Biol Chem. 2012 May 4;287(19):15298-306. PMID: 22418440
